subgoal: Gather ingredients: bacon or guanciale, pecorino romano cheese, eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic or olive oil.
original_subgoals: Gather the ingredients: guanciale (or pancetta), pecorino romano cheese, free-range organic eggs, pasta, black pepper, and optionally garlic.

subgoal: Cut bacon or guanciale into pieces and cook in a pan until crispy, optionally adding garlic or olive oil for flavor.
original_subgoals: Cut guanciale (or pancetta) into chunks.
Heat olive oil in a pan and cook the guanciale until it releases fat.
Remove the skin from the guanciale and cut it into half-centimeter chunks.
Place the guanciale in a cold pan and turn the heat to medium-high to render the fat. Optionally, add a cracked garlic clove to the pan for flavor.
Once the guanciale is golden, remove the garlic from the pan.
Cut thick slices of bacon (or use pancetta) and cook in a pan over medium heat with a little olive oil until crispy, rendering out the fat.
Chop bacon into small pieces.
Cook the bacon in a pan until crispy, then turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.

subgoal: Boil water in a pot, add salt, and cook pasta until al dente, stirring occasionally and reserving some pasta water before draining.
original_subgoals: Boil water and add salt at a ratio of 10 grams per liter.
Add spaghettoni to the boiling water and cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Boil water in a pot and add a small amount of salt. Twist the pasta and place it in the water to prevent sticking. Cook for about 8 minutes.
Boil water in a pot, add a tablespoon of kosher salt, and cook spaghetti until slightly al dente.
Boil water in a pot, add salt, and cook spaghetti until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water before draining the spaghetti.

subgoal: Grate cheese and prepare the egg mixture by whisking eggs with cheese and black pepper.
original_subgoals: In a bowl, beat two egg yolks (for two people) and add grated parmesan or pecorino cheese and abundant pepper.
Crack black peppercorns using a pestle and mortar, then sift to use the hotter inner part of the peppercorns.
Crack eggs into a bowl and add about 20 grams of pecorino cheese. Whisk together.
Grate equal parts Pecorino Romano and Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, about three ounces each.
Whisk together three whole eggs and two egg yolks, then mix in the grated cheese and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper.
Separate egg yolks from the whites and place the yolks in a bowl.
Grate pecorino romano cheese and add it to the egg yolks.
Add freshly ground black pepper to the egg yolk and cheese mixture and mix well.

subgoal: Add a small amount of reserved pasta water to the egg and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese and prevent scrambling.
original_subgoals: Add a small amount of pasta water to the egg mixture to temper it and prevent scrambling.
Add a small amount of reserved pasta water to the egg yolk and cheese mixture to help melt the cheese.

subgoal: Transfer the cooked pasta to the pan with bacon or guanciale, mixing to coat with rendered fat.
original_subgoals: Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the pan with guanciale, allowing it to cool slightly.
Turn off the heat under the guanciale pan. Transfer the cooked pasta directly from the pot to the pan with some pasta water to stop frying and start emulsifying.
Mix the pasta with the rendered fat and pasta water to create a creamy sauce base.
Once the bacon is crispy, remove some for garnish and drain most of the fat, leaving about two tablespoons in the pan.
Turn off the heat and add the cooked spaghetti to the pan with the bacon fat.
Transfer the cooked spaghetti directly from the pot to the pan with bacon, without draining completely.

subgoal: Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce, adding more pasta water if needed.
original_subgoals: Mix the pasta with the egg mixture, ensuring the pasta is not too hot to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Stir the pasta until the sauce is creamy and coats the pasta evenly.
Add the egg and cheese mixture to the pasta, tossing and adding more pasta water as needed to achieve a creamy consistency.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot pasta, stirring gently to coat the pasta without scrambling the eggs.
If the sauce is too thick, add a little reserved pasta water to loosen it.
Mix the spaghetti with the bacon and then add the egg yolk mixture, stirring quickly to coat the pasta and create a creamy sauce.
If needed, add more reserved pasta water to achieve the desired sauce consistency.

subgoal: Finish with additional grated cheese, black pepper, and crispy bacon or guanciale pieces before serving.
original_subgoals: Serve with additional grated parmesan or pecorino and a touch of pepper for decoration.
Finish with additional cracked black pepper and a sprinkle of pecorino cheese before serving.
Plate the pasta, top with more grated cheese and crispy bacon pieces.
Finish with additional grated pecorino romano and black pepper before serving.
